qas.question: New techniques of building construction are being researched, made possible by advances in what?
Building printing is making it possible to flexibly construct small commercial buildings and private habitations in what amount of time?
Dutch architect Janjaap Ruijssenaars's performative architecture 3D-printed building is scheduled to be built when?

answers.text: Working versions of 3D-printing building technology are already printing

qas.question: Working versions of 3D-printing building technology are already printing how much building material per hour?
What is Janjaap Ruijssenaar going to build in 2013?
What makes research in built-in plumbing possible?

plausible_answers.text: the additive manufacturing techniques for manufactured parts

qas.question: What is flexible construction similar to?
How long does it take to build electrical facilities?

plausible_answers.text: 2 metres (6 ft 7 in) of building material per hour

qas.question: As of 2014 how quickly is building material being printed?

context: New techniques of building construction are being researched, made possible by <a0_2><b5_0>advances in <a0_0><a0_1>3D printing technology<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>. In a form of additive building construction, similar to <b6_0>the additive manufacturing techniques for manufactured parts<b6_0/>, building printing is making it possible to flexibly construct small commercial buildings and private habitations <b7_0>in <a1_0><a1_1>around <a1_2>20 hours<b7_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, with built-in plumbing and electrical facilities, in one continuous build, using large 3D printers. <a2_0>Working versions of 3D-printing building technology are already printing<a2_0/> <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>2 metres (6 ft 7 in)<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> of building material per hour<b8_0/> as of January 2013[update], with the next-generation printers capable of 3.5 metres (11 ft) per hour, sufficient to complete a building in a week. Dutch architect Janjaap Ruijssenaars's <b4_0>performative architecture 3D-printed building<b4_0/> is scheduled to be built in <a2_1><a2_2>2014<a2_2/><a2_1/>.
